intro: Mesogramma, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars, hence its common name. Mesogramma typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, shaded environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
